intro: Lappula anocarpa, commonly known as the smooth lappula, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. The plant has smooth, hairless leaves and produces capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in dry, disturbed soils in temperate regions. Lappula anocarpa is adapted to thrive in sunny, open habitats and is relatively uncommon in the wild.
